fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32537].
  {panel}

Given the following situation :

# A filter is created that has results spanning more than 1 page
# The user navigated through that filter to find a certain issue (that is not at the first page)
# The issue is accessed, and edited
# The user goes back to the filter via the 'Issues' dropdown menu.

Currently, after the fourth step, when the user goes back to the filter, they will be returned to the first page of the filter results. This can be problematic and somewhat frustrating when the user has a high amount of results in the filter (for example, a few hundred issues).

It would be more efficient if the user can be returned to the results page where they accessed the issue earlier. For example, if the issue that the user accessed is in page 3 of the Issue Navigator results, then when the user accesses the same filter, he/she will straightaway go to page 3 of the Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Return to the selected issue in Issue Navigator after an operation

  {panel}

Currently, the embedded link on the email will be processed as text, user will like to see the mail handler to able to handle the embedded link from email to avoid losing the information on it.

*Steps to replicate*
# Create test mail handler
# Search for email that has the embedded link (something like [SAC|http://support.atlassian.com])
# Send/Drop to the folder the mail handler is looking
# Noticed that it is only captured as SAC.
fields.summary: Mail Handler to be Able to Handle Embedded Link from Email

There is no way to get JIRA to reliably connect to an MSSQL database using windows authentication. Tested both with and without the username XML element.

SQL connection string:
{code:xml}
 <jdbc-datasource>
    <url>jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://dbserver:1439/JIRADB</url>
    <driver-class>net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver</driver-class>
    <username>windowsUser</username>
  </jdbc-datasource>
{code}


Per JTDS documentation: (README.SSO)
{code}
    In order for Single Sign On to work, jTDS must be able to load the native
    SPPI library (ntlmauth.dll). Place this DLL anywhere in the system path
    (defined by the PATH system variable) and you're all set.
{code}

JIRA startup error:

Documentation For Unresolved Issue in CSV Import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32531].
  {panel}

Copied from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-918

As stated in the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+CSV#ImportingDatafromCSV-TipsforimportingCSVdataintoJIRAfields]:
{quote}If not specified in your CSV file, imported issues will be given the default (i.e. first) Priority as specified in your JIRA system  Defining 'Priority' Field Values. You can also create new JIRA values on-the-fly during the import process.{quote}

Therefore, if the priority of the issue is not specified in the CSV file, it should be updated if the default priority has been speicified in JIRA. The behaviour should be the same with Issue Key, where if the issue key is not specified in the CSV file, it will get updated to the default.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Specify the default priority in JIRA
# Create an issue with the priority different from the default
# Create a CSV file with issuekey,summary
# Import the CSV file
# Only Issuetype gets updated but not priority field
fields.summary: The priority does not get updated when editing issue via CSV import

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32520].
  {panel}

Not sure "caching" is the best term.  But here's the behavior we had, lost, and would like back again.
This was all working rather nicely before 6.0 but I guess it was undocumented behavior.

When I pull up a filter and select the first item it bring up that Issue with a block on the right corner which has up/down arrows for navigating through that list of issues and a counter indicating where I am "x of Y issues".
If I update an issue, which would cause it to fall outside of the original filter set (eg: assignee=currentUser() and I reassign issue) this navigation block is removed.

What I would like to have is for the Filter set to remain as an navigable list of issues so that I can effectively navigate the entire list without having to requery my filter all the time.

For example: I would like to retrieve a list of all the issues that are assigned to me (eg: "to do") and work through them throughout the day off this list.  In the event that I update/modify/move the issue which would cause it to fall outside of this filter result set, I would like to keep it on this list of "to do" items so that I can continue working through the list.  If I need to regenerate/update the filter results, I can alway use the "return to results" link that used to be there and requery the filter.

Without this functionality there is no efficient or practical way to work through a "to do" list of issues to act upon.
This makes the process of updating multiple tickets in succession very difficult.

This mentions JIRA Toolkit Plugin but that doesn't seem to show up in the stack trace.

h3. Summary

When trying to send notifications/mail from JIRA, a {{java.lang.ClassCastException}} is thrown.

h3. Environment

* JIRA 6.0-m10: Mac OS X 10.7.5 / PostgreSQL 9.1
* OD: Standard environment

# Add the Participants Custom Field.
# Add the Custom Field to the Issue Commented Notification Scheme.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32512].
  {panel}

I asked this question in Altassian Answers, but it seems like there is no possible way to do this now, the question is in (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/154529/is-there-a-way-to-set-field-value-from-parent-but-not-replacing-the-existing-value)

Is there a way to Set Field Value from Parent but not replacing the existing value?

Basically, I am looking for a way to set a value from parent's issue only if the person who file the subtask didn't put a value for a specific field.

Currently, the Set Field Value from Parent is limited to replace existing values which is limited for us.

The example I used is component.

For example, I have a workflow to set component from a parent task. However, we would like the ability for users to put in the necessary component even if it's a different component from the parent's task.

Parent Task has component "A"

I created a subtask under that Parent Task, but fills in component "B"

Ends result right now is that my Subtask has component "A" and component "B" was removed.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Workflow Post Function: Set Field Value from Parent additional options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32510].
  {panel}

It takes about 10 minutes to open report configuration page of JIRA Timesheet Plugin because of 10K groups in Atlassian Crowd directory connected to JIRA.

It may be a regression, as it's working fine on JIRA 5.0.5 and 5.1.8.

Note, problem is even worse for some customers:
* 20 minutes to open report configuration page here https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/issue/346/jira-timesheet-reports-is-working-realy
* OOM here https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/153863/time-sheet-reports-don-t-open-in-jira-5-2-7) 

Steps to reproduce:

Prerequisites:
1) JIRA 5.2.10 (latest)
2) Install Atlassian Crowd (evaluation license is enough) and integrate it with JIRA as described here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Integrating+Crowd+with+Atlassian+JIRA
3) Generate 10K groups (e.g. using ruby script: https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/src/default/src/test/ruby/generate-crowd-groups.rb)
4) JIRA Timesheet Plugin installed (latest version): https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/jira-timesheet-plugin

Scenario:
1) Go to Projects -> e.g. Demo project -> Reports -> Time Sheet Report
2) Expected page loaded in 3s or less, but it hangs for 10 minutes or more , with no any response from server, or even OutOfMemory happens.

Note, problem is caused by Group selector, however backing GroupValuesGenerator is out of concerns, because it's used in Timesheet Gadget also, and there is no any problem with response time.
fields.summary: Very slow response on report configuration page with 10K crowd groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32508].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate:

- Create a test issue on a given project using JIRA Default Workflow
- Go to the Issue Navigator and perform a search on this project
- The issue will be retrieved
- Create a new event associated to the Issue Created template
- Make a copy of JIRA Default Workflow and on the "create Issue" transition, change the event from Issue Created to the Custom Event created on the previous step
- Create a new issue
- Go to the issue navigator and perform a search on this project
- The issue created right after the change of events will not be displayed
- Run a background reindex on the instance
- Perform a search on the project again
- The issue still won't be displayed
- Run a full reindex
- Perform a search on the issue navigator for this project. This time the issue *will* be displayed.

I believe the event only sets the notification scheme, and it is not associated with indexing at all, but in this case, it seems to be related to it.

*As a workaround solution:* Please add the "Re-Index Issue" in the post function of the workflow transition if you wish to use the custom event. 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/New+created+issue+is+not+showing+on+the+issue+navigator
fields.summary: Custom event on "create issue" transition and Indexing problems

fields.description:
Hi experts,

we using JIRA 5.07 in our company and use the webservice method getIssuesFromJqlSearch( ).
If there is an illegal character in some of the description fields we receive the following response:

AXIS error
Sorry, something seems to have gone wrong... here are the details:
Fault - ; nested exception is: 
        java.io.IOException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The char '0xb' after 'Enable the maintenance side of the business
Install and geo-tag equipment, including meters
View asset schematics, history, dependencies
Execute to guided workflows
Generate notifications and work orders' is not a valid XML character.
AxisFault
faultCode: {http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Server.userException
faultSubcode: 
faultString: java.io.IOException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The char '0xb' after 'Enable the maintenance side of the business
Install and geo-tag equipment, including meters
View asset schematics, history, dependencies
Execute to guided workflows
Generate notifications and work orders' is not a valid XML character.
faultActor: 
faultNode: 
faultDetail: 
        {http://xml.apache.org/axis/}hostname:coevi11


So I expect that JIRA not support to save illegal characters or it should convert it to legal ones before it is send to the AXIS framework.
At the moment we have so the problem that we can't continue with the data read because we didn't receive an useable response.

Please provide a solution for that.

Best regards,
Martin

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32487].
  {panel}

At the current moment, there is no method for administrator to know if there any attempt made by anyone to login into JIRA that has failed. 

For example: 
* currently the Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed is set to 3
* when there are more than 3 failed attempt made, the CAPTCHA is shown
* however, administrator are not aware that there are failed attempt unless manually checking in the Users list

It's important for administrator to know especially if the username involved is used by REST client. This is because, the REST client will not be completed as it can't pass the value of the CAPTCHA.

Suggestion: send notification to administrator of username that has exceed the fail attempt so that administrator can clear the login attempt.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32464].
  {panel}

*Expected behavior:*  Having navigated to a page > 1 in Issue Navigator search results, clicking Tools > Bulk Change: current page, the bulk editor returns the issues on that page.

*Actual behavior:* Clicking Tools > Bulk Change: current page, the bulk editor returns the issues listed on Page 1 of the Issue Navigator results.

*Steps to reproduce:*
In the Issue Navigator
# Search for issues in JIRA, make sure the # of results returned is > 100. Make a note of the issues that appear in page 1 of the results.
# Click the right arrow or page number to navigate to a page other than Page 1.  Make note of the issues  on this page.
# Click *Tools* then select *Bulk Change: current page*
# Note the issue IDs listed are the same as on Page 1 of Issue Navigator results rather than the expected results from a subsequent page. 

*Workaround*
# Follow the above steps. 
#  At the end of the process, click the *Back* button on your browser to return to the Issue Navigator Results.
# Select Tools > Bulk Change: current page again.
# The proper results will appear in the bulk editor.
fields.summary: In Issue Navigator, Bulk Change->current page returns first page of results, not the one you're on

Currently the Summary report for the Component on a project will only display:
* Issue Key
* Summary
* Updated
An improvement would be the ability to customise the addition of fields to this display, similar to the attached example.

A workaround is to select 'Issues' instead of summary and perform additional filtering from the selected options.  The above could reduce the need for these additional selections.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32414].
  {panel}

Create a custom Free Text field.
Add some descriptive text in the Description box.
In the Field Configuration, make sure that your new Text Field uses a Wiki Style Renderer.

PROBLEM: The descriptive text is separated from the field/box by the two little icons (Preview and MarkupHelp). This makes it very unclear what the Description refers to. This is especially noticeable if there are several Free Text fields on the screen. The location of the Description makes it look like it refers to the subsequent Text Field.

REQUEST: Please relocate the icons or the text. (Or float them side-by-side)
fields.summary: relocate the explanatory text of custom (wiki-rendered) fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32394].
  {panel}

# Set your account's profile timezone to differ from the server (I created a new OnDemand instance set to US/Chicago then set my profile to Australia/Sydney).
# Start a new basic search, add Due Date to the fields.
# Select "Date between" and choose two different dates (say, 2nd April and 6th April).
# Save that filter, then reload the page.

The dates will have changed to 1st April and 5th April and are saved directly in the database with these values. Advanced Search in unaffected, this only occurs with Basic Search. It _doesn't_ occur if your profile timezone is set to the same timezone as the JIRA server is (be it by manually selecting the same timezone or choosing "JIRA default").

I've been able to replicate this in SAC as well.
fields.summary: "Date Between" search in Basic Search changes dates upon saving if profile timezone differs from server timezone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32387].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:
We know that exist REST APIs under */rest/gadget* because we can call the following URLs and it will return information:

* http://localhost:8080/rest/gadget/1.0/currentUser
* http://localhost:8080/rest/gadget/1.0/filtersAndProjects?showFilters=false

h3. The problem:
The problem is that there isn't any documentation describing all the available REST APIs for it. Currently the docs about REST APIs don't include any reference to */rest/gadget*. See the following links:

* https://developer.atlassian.com/static/rest/jira/5.2.9.html
* http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/
fields.summary: Update REST API documentation to include information under gadget API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32386].
  {panel}

When a Project has a default issue security level set for all newly created issues, and a user (who is *not allowed* to view the issue because of the default security level set) tries to create an issue from email with attachments, the issue is created successfully but the attachments are rejected with the following error message that is added as a comment on the issue:
{noformat}
Reporter (johndoe) does not have permission to create attachments in project XXXX. 
Following attachments found in the email have been discarded:
aaa.xlsx
bbb.jpg
{noformat}

-This has been reproduced in a 5.1.8 instance, but isn't reproduceable in 5.2.5.- now also happening on 6.3-OD-04-019

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create an issue security scheme in a project, with security levels restricting a particular user (reporter) from viewing the issue. Set this is as the default issue security level.
# Have that user create an issue via email with attachments.
# Observe that issue is created successfully, but permissions message is created as a comment on the issue and attachments are dropped. [^Untitled.jpg]

Screenshots added showing the same attachment sent via email to the same project when there is no Issue Security Scheme restricting the user (test_attachment_OK.jpeg) and later after adding Issue Security Scheme restricting the user (test_attachment_FAIL.jpeg)
fields.summary: Mail Handler unable to create attachments from email when reporter is not in the default issue security level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32371].
  {panel}

After the last OnDemand upgrade, users are not able to perform the following operations anymore (using Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox):

- *Shift* + Left-Click = Open ticket in a new *window*
- *Ctrl* + Left-Click = Open ticket in a new *tab*

For instance, when performing an JQL search, user usually would use *Ctrl* + Click to open issues in new tabs. This doesn't happen anymore, both operations now open the ticket on the same window.

This slows down significantly the use of JIRA.
fields.summary: Users unable to open tickets in new windows/tabs

Due to a security risk it was decided that only system-administrators have the permission to upload workflow bundles to JIRA. As no customer in JIRA OnDemand has system-admin privileges, it is not possible to upload workflows.

The use case satisfied by doing this work is:
* Allow imports between OD instances
* Allow imports between OD instance and BTF (and vice versa)
fields.summary: Give administrators the permission to upload/import workflow bundles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32350].
  {panel}

I've seen two cases now where the Outgoing Mail page has said that outgoing mail is disabled, but the big button to enable mail is not visible to regular admins, only sysadmins.

It should be visible for admins as well.

Because of how OnDemand vs BTF work we should:

* Create an option on the JIRA Mail Queue page or the General Config page for enabling / disabling mail
* Only show this option if the instance is an OnDemand instance, not for BTF

This prevents us revealing the mail config page in OD and prevents doubling up config options for BTF customers
fields.summary: "Enable Outgoing Mail" button on the Outgoing Mail admin page should be visible to regular admins, not just sysadmins

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 28 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hello All,

Given our current product priorities and other high ranking JAC issues we do not have plans to add MariaDB support in the foreseeable future.
If anyone has DB vendor/type marketshare information - I'd love to see it to make an assessment of whether to add this to our supported platforms.
When choosing to add a supported platform we assess the expected benefit of minimising the number of supported platforms vs. the level of tech debt that reduces our development velocity.

Thanks for your feedback and we hope you appreciate our open approach to these requests.

Danke schoen,
Otto Ruettinger
JIRA Principal Product Manager

{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

JIRA does not officially document the support of Maria DB, or indicate any support for this. As some major Linux distributions are moving to use MariaDB and the functionality is similar, it would be good to provide support for this Database version. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Officially support MariaDB for JIRA, including adding documentation and any other articles as required.

h3. Workaround

MySQL can be installed on RHEL, Oracle Linux, CentOS and Fedora using the MySQL Yum repository, https://dev.mysql.com/downloads/repo/yum/. The [Quick Guide to Using the MySQL Yum Repository|https://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql-yum-repo-quick-guide/en/] walks through how to configure the repository and install MySQL.
fields.summary: JIRA should support MariaDB
